snippet: A YouTube video was posted to raise money for the defense of the Huangs of Los Angeles, whose adopted daughter — known to go on hunger strikes — died after four days of not eating.
abstract: Advocates for Matthew and Grace Huang, American citizens imprisoned in Qatar after their adopted African daughter died after not eating for days, post YouTube video purporting to offer new insight into child's death and to help raise funds for their defense; couple has denied any wrongdoing in their daughter's death; State Department has expressed concern about fairness of judicial process in case.

byline.contributor: Shabina S. Khatri contributed reporting from Doha, Qatar.

lead_paragraph: A YouTube video was posted to raise money for the defense of the Huangs of Los Angeles, whose adopted daughter — known to go on hunger strikes — died after four days of not eating.

headline.main: A Push to Aid American Couple Held in Child’s Death in Qatar
headline.print_headline: A Push to Aid Couple Held in Child’s Death in Qatar
